sub_title: Delivering value through Supply Chain Management
summary:
I am a Senior Supply Chain Project Coordinator at ASML. Collaborating to solve clients’ complex supply chain challenges is what gets me up every day. I am part of the PLM team at ASML coordinating timely material availability within cost and with highest quality. 

At o9 Solutions, I was part of the Global Alliances Presales (Sales Engineering) team responsible for partner sales enablement, and developing Go-to-Market demo assets for sales cycles in the Europe region.

Prior to o9 Solutions, I was a Procurement and Supply Planning Program manager at Whirlpool with 10 years of experience in global strategic sourcing, supply chain management, and new product development. I am an inventor with a US Patent and a certified 6 Sigma Black belt. I executed projects across the pillars of cost, quality, and innovation at global manufacturing sites in India, the US, and Mexico in partnership with global teams. 

I graduated from MIT SCALE, Zaragoza Logistics Center (Spain) with a Master of Engineering (Supply Chain Management and Logistics) degree in June 2022. I also have a Bachelor’s in Electrical Engineering and a Master’s in Management Science.

I have the personality of "The Challenger" as per Enneagram 
(Read here: https://www.enneagraminstitute.com/type-8) and my mission is to bring continuous improvement to Global Supply Chain Operations.

Please feel free to connect me through below contact details:
Email id: sushanth777@gmail.com
Contact number: +31685488674

awards.title: 2nd Prize winner in MIT SCALE Supply Chain Challenge
“MIT - Zaragoza Supporting Promising Professionals in Logistics and Supply Chain Management Scholarship”
Pinnacle Award 2019
awards.description: Sushanth took lead in Cost and Quality projects for Pune Refrigeration Operations in Single Door & Frost Free products. He executed projects worth $4.4M savings versus target of $2.M. He went beyond his job scope and took additional responsibility of Supply Assurance to Pune plant deliver of 1.4 Mn products in 2019 versus 0.95Mn products in 2018 (40% growth). Sushsanth's contributions helped in achieving production growth in Pune, over achievement of P4G targets which has contributed in delvering top line growth for Whirlpool

awards.title: The Constellation- Best performing team Q4 2019
awards.description: PRO GSS team demonstrated Whirlpool values 'Own it', 'Play to Win', and 'One Whirlpool' by developing more than 50 parts for 200 L Mass Aesthetics & New DC Line in a challenging time frame of 5 months. Team ensured that proper technical reviews happened, all parts are developed first time right & capacities at suppliers are built in line with our new DC line requirement. Despite of regular production pressure in PRO with 40% volume growth , team stretched themselves & completed all the activities 2 weeks before G2 committed SOP which helped Whirlpool to build adequate stock of new product in the field before launch.

awards.title: GSS Super Heroes- Global Recognition in Oct 2019
awards.description: On request of the Trade & online companies (Amazon, Walmart), it was decided to make the packaging of all products not only more robust but also to have a perception of Best-in-class packaging. Team worked on a target cost ; conducted a supplier catalyst with our Packaging suppliers, did competitive bench marking & worked with our Design & Quality organization to develop a cost optimized solution.

awards.title: You are a Star - Best performer in Aug 2019
awards.description: Sushanth demonstrated Lead with Speed and Have Passion by mitigating the risk of no material from a single source for Refrigerator .He developed and ramped up production from New Alternate source starting from 1st Production. He followed all processes namely Engineering Qualification , trial , Cost Settlement and delivery in 5 days time despite all odds. He collaborated and ensured that the production didn't got affected without any escalation by supply chain team.Will call Sushanth  unsung Hero in the crisis situation.

awards.title: The Constellation- Best performing team Q2 2019
awards.description: Team has demonstrated the true example of "One Whirlpool". Last three months the team took a challenge to deliver the nos as required by market. In-spite of lot of all the challenges, team stood together & delivered record volume consistently & consecutively for last three months .(1.22 L, 1.34 L & 1,40 L)

awards.title: The Constellation- Best performing team in Q1 2019
awards.description: The team displayed "Play to win & Lead with Speed" during the launch of L60 & L55 convertible project. The convertible series launch was very critical for Whirlpool to compete against the latest competition moves in the market. The team took the challenge and ensured all parts readiness within a short span of 2 weeks which involved 1st-time right development of IMD with SJS, the readiness of electrons boards with new software, tint change for 20 plastic parts, development of user manual and UI stickers well on time despite multiple iterations.

awards.title: Stellar Team- Best performing teams in 2017
awards.description: First of kind consolidation/collaboration of Team to drive extraordinary results in Cost Delivery. The global Electronics and Electrical Systems Leadership highly appreciated Team's ownership and contribution in $110 Million delivery.

awards.title: The Constellation- Best performing team in Q1 2017
awards.description: This award is to recognize the "One Whirlpool" value demonstrated by Electronic  & Electrical Systems and Dishwasher team in delivering the first Trans regional Sales project for China from Global technology and Engineering Center. The whole project was delivered within 3 months till production.

awards.title: You are a Star-Best performer in June 2016
awards.description: Demonstrated "Own It" and "Lead with Speed" by leading the Whirlpool Product Development Process and Functional Documents creation for Wiring team.

awards.title: The Constellation-Best performing team in Q4 2016
awards.description: This team consistently demonstrated "Play to Win" while working for Total Cost of Productivity (TCP) projects. Globally highly appreciated as the initiative began in middle of this year and commendable job to consolidate the numbers in such short time to achieve annual cash flow of seedbed worth of around $20 Million.

awards.title: You are a Star-Best performer in August 2015
awards.description: Demonstrated "Unleash Talent" and "Own It" behaviors by generating the cost reduction pipeline for Whirlpool of India and driving workshop for Work Life Balance within team.

profile_positions.description:
•	Trained and mentored 65+ consultants from 5 Management Consulting and System integrator firms in 10+ workshops,  to conduct demos and sales pitches.
•	Drove Demand and Supply Planning, Control Tower, S&OP, and Project Based Planning deep dive sessions with partners for 3 specific clients in Industrial Manufacturing and CPG industries.
•	Co-developed Order Planning use case demo with Logistics Visibility Platform (project44) for joint sales cycles leading 3 new lead accounts in 3 months.
•	Coordinated with cross-functional teams to devise and execute Presales strategies for a major automobile manufacturer valued at $1.39bn. 
•	Delivered RFP proposals, conducted detailed use case analysis, and created demo storyboards, resulting in a 15% increase in sales conversion rate.
•	Optimized partner demo certification process with a Self-Learning User Journey that empowered partners to learn and certify, reducing the resource commitment of 2 employees/day/biweekly.
•	o9 Platform Solution training: o9 Functional and Use cases, Reference Model: Demand Planning, Supply Planning, Control Tower, o9 Platform Technical Configurations, Supply Chain Solver, Platform Architecture and Integration
profile_positions.title: Senior Presales Consultant - Alliances (Cross Industry)

profile_positions.description:
•	Projected 30% return on invested capital (ROIC) in a joint venture initiative, by managing a capital budget worth $4.5M and, by leading sourcing deliverables that included source selection, target costing, make vs. buy analysis and supply chain optimization.
•	Enabled 30% volume growth of 0.9M units/year by developing 160 new components through 20 suppliers for a platform refresh initiative consisting of 30 SKUs in collaboration with entire sourcing team of commodity analysts, buyers and cost analysts. 
•	Co-ordinated business continuity planning for refrigerators considering 3-year demand forecasts, growing at 30% Y-o-Y by monitoring and brining visibility to deep tier supplier inventory and evaluating alternate sourcing plans.
•	Managed supply base for 3 major commodities with 35 global suppliers and created supplier risk management framework, by assessing supplier operational health, reviewing inventory policies and mapping supplier capacities. 
•	Accelerated cash flows worth $4.2M in 2019 and $5.59M in 2020 and 2% supply base consolidation by driving profit for growth initiatives through supplier localization, dual sourcing, alternate material usage and supplier process re-engineering.
•	Attained 5-star consumer ratings for premium segment refrigerators on e-commerce platform and avoided 1.5% revenue loss by driving quality initiatives on new packaging standards through market analysis, competitive benchmarking and supplier catalyst workshops.
•	Recognized by Pinnacle award given to top 20 among 2500 employees in 2019 for my outstanding performance for delivering Cost productivity of $4.2M and for leading NPI and Supply assurance supporting 30% volume growth.
profile_positions.title: New Product Introductions (NPI) Project Manager, Global Strategic Sourcing

profile_positions.description:
•	Led product engineering team of 20 engineers and delivered design and development of 150+ projects for consumer electronics products across North America, Latin America, EMEA and Asia manufacturing plants.	
•	Transformed design delivery by executing 35 lean six-sigma projects resulting in 16% improvement in quality, 11% improvement in productivity and reducing around 72000 manhours Y-o-Y.
•	Granted US Patent 10027866 for realizing consumer need of “remote visibility of refrigerator contents” by designing internal content cameras and defining its operation method.
•	Six Sigma Black Belt, Projects: Solved 7 wicked problems through experimentation and use of data analysis in the span of 2 years that resulted in $150K cost savings, avoided customer safety issue and revitalized new product lighting solutions.
profile_positions.title: Engineering Manager- Global Product Organisation

profile_positions.description:
•	Redesigned and reduced part complexity by 20% by collaborating with suppliers, engineering and marketing teams to streamline product architectures for 5 years product plans. 
•	Spearheaded tier 2 components materials value team globally resulting in $15M savings and 10% complexity reduction over 2 years by implementing new governance structure and by consolidating technology roadmaps using modular architecture.
•	Organized design to value workshops focusing on functional analysis, design for manufacturing and assembly, and value methodology to reduce produce cost and add value to customer.
profile_positions.title: Senior Engineer- Global Product Organisation

profile_positions.description:
• Led workshops to generate pipelines for cost saving opportunities in Mexico and US
• Coordinated entire cost and quality delivery for wiring harness for US and Mexico
• Led electrical design for New Product Introduction projects & supported onsite execution in US of 3 projects
• Led Total Cost of Quality project worth $250K Annualized for Amana BM (US plant)
• Coordinated model line initiatives for Mexico plant to resolve Bill of Material issues on 30 SKUs
profile_positions.title: Design Engineer- Global Product Organisation

profile_positions.description:
•	Supported engineers on project delivery by creating electrical schematics
•	Lead a $50K cost project for Mexico region

volunteer_experiences.description: Participated as a committee member in organizing a national level event "Joy Fest" - Xpressionzz for raising funds for social services.

Organized blood donation camp on 13th March 2009 in PVG's College of engineering and technology where 138 voluntary donors donated their blood. It had helped the transfusion therapy needs of critically ill patients in Deenanth Mangeshkar Hospital and Research Center and nearby nursing homes.
